component 0: [["What tablets do I need to drink?", "Based on the medical information provided, it appears that you have been prescribed Ibuprofen, a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID), to help reduce pain and inflammation in the TMJ area. It's important to take the medication as directed by your doctor and to not exceed the recommended dosage. Additionally, it's important to avoid alcohol while taking Ibuprofen as it can increase the risk of stomach ulcers and bleeding. If you have any questions or concerns about your medication, please don't hesitate to reach out to your healthcare provider."]]

[["Can I drink alcohol?", "Hello Oleg, I hope you're feeling well today. Based on your medical history and current treatment plan, it's recommended that you avoid drinking alcohol for the next three months. Alcohol can exacerbate your headaches and TMJ symptoms, as well as interact with the medication you're currently taking. It's important to give your body the best chance to heal and recover, so try to abstain from alcohol during this period. Instead, focus on stress-reducing activities like meditation, yoga, and deep breathing exercises, which can also help alleviate your TMJ symptoms and headaches. If you have any other questions or concerns, please feel free to ask!"]]
